add_guardTour_h.intro_Txt: Make the following settings for the new guard tour:
add_guardTour_h.txt1: Name - Enter the name of the new guard tour.
add_guardTour_h.txt2: Select Random view order to display the preset positions in random order. If not selected, set the view order for each position in the field provided in Source.
add_guardTour_h.time_Txt: Pause between runs - Enter the number of minutes the guard tour should wait before running again.
add_guardTour_h.presets_txt: Select a preset from the drop-down list and click Add. The preset appears in the list of added presets under Source.
add_guardTour_h.source_txt: Once a preset has been added, it is then possible to configure:
add_guardTour_h.sourceVwT_txt2: the View Order (see also Random view order above)
add_guardTour_h.sourceMve_txt: the Move Speed at which to move the camera to the preset position
add_guardTour_h.sourceVwT_txt4: the View Order (see also Random view order above)
add_guardTour_h.sourceVwT_txt5: Click the Remove link to remove the preset from the Guard Tour.

add_recordedTour_h.intro_Txt: Make the following settings for the new recorded tour:
add_recordedTour_h.txt1: Name - Enter a friendly name for the new recorded tour. The friendly name will be used on different configuration pages such as the embedded event pages where a preset position or a guard tour can be selected.
add_recordedTour_h.txt2: Pause between runs - Enter the number of minutes the recorded tour should wait before running again.
add_recordedTour_h.record_button_txt: Press the Record button to start and stop recording or to replace an existing tour. Recording of the PTZ movement will start immediately and the recording button will start blinking. The recording will be stopped automatically after 16 min.
add_recordedTour_h.play_button_txt: Press the Play button to verify the recorded tour before saving. During playback the play button will turn into a pause button enabling the operator to pause the playback.
add_recordedTour_h.stop_button_txt: Press the Stop button to stop a recording or playback.
add_recordedTour_h.cameracontrol_button_txt: Use the Joystick emulation to pan and tilt the camera and use the zoom bar for zooming.
add_recordedTour_h.oK_button_txt: Press the OK button to save the recording and exit the recorded tour setup.
add_recordedTour_h.cancel_button_txt: Press Cancel to exit the recorded tour setup without saving.

add_tour_h.txt: Recorded tour setup - Record the tour with PTZ using any type of input devices like a joystick, mouse, keyboard, maneuver board or ADP application using VAPIX.
add_tour_h.preset_Txt: Preset tour setup - Set up PTZ to move from one preset to another with individual speeds between presets and individual pauses at each presets.
add_tour_h.record_Txt: Select the Create a record tour or the Create a preset tour radio button and press OK to set up a recorded- or a preset tour.

driverSelection_h.introTxt: A PTZ driver is required for the correct function of a connected Pan Tilt Zoom device. You can download the latest drivers from www.axis.com and then upload it to the Axis product.
driverSelection_h.helpUploadTxt: To upload a PTZ driver, Click Browse to locate the file and then click Upload.
driverSelection_h.helpUpload2Txt1: From the Uploaded drivers drop-down list, select the driver to be installed and click Save. If the driver was successfully installed the name will appear for Installed driver.
driverSelection_h.helpUpload2Txt2: To delete a driver that has been uploaded, select it from the Uploaded drivers drop-down list and click Remove.
driverSelection_h.help3Txt1: Activate PTZ - Select this to enable PTZ.
driverSelection_h.help3Txt2: Device ID - This is the address of the connected device. To find the Device ID consult the video source's documentation.
driverSelection_h.help4Txt: Device Type - Choose the Device type from the drop-down list. To find which Device type to use, consult the documentation supplied by the PTZ driver.
driverSelection_h.help5Txt: To complete the installation go to System Options > Ports & Devices > COM Port and verify the settings.

guardTour_h.intro_Txt1: The list on this page shows the guard tours currently configured in the Axis product.
guardTour_h.intro_Txt2: A guard tour is an automated series of camera movements from one preset position to another. A guard tour can be set up to display the video streams from different preset positions in a pre-determined order or at random, and for configurable time periods.
guardTour_h.intro_Txt3: Click the Add button to set up a new guard tour, Modify to change, and Remove to remove an existing guard tour. The button Start/Stop will start or stop the guard tour.
guardTour_h.intro_Txt4: Note 1: Once a guard tour has been started it will continue to run until stopped again, even when there are no clients (web browsers) viewing the images.
guardTour_h.note_Txt1: Note 2: To schedule a Guard Tour, go to the Events menu.
guardTour_h.note_Txt2: This is not the case for a Sequence Mode, which although similar to a guard tour, will stop running as soon as the web browser is closed or navigates away from the Live View page.

ptz_h.virtual_introTxt: This page provides the tools for creating and saving Preset positions. The entire area that was defined under View Areas will be treated as the Home position, which is then readily accessible by clicking on the Home button in both the Preset Position Setup window and the Live View window.
ptz_h.introTxt: This page provides the tools for creating and saving Preset positions.
ptz_h.help2Txt: A preset position is a pre-defined camera view that can quickly and easily be viewed, simply by selecting the preset's name.
ptz_h.preset_pos_temp: Preset positions can be used at temperatures above 10 °C (50 °F).
ptz_h.mvctrlTxt: Using the Pan, Tilt and Zoom (PTZ) controls, move the camera view to the required position.
ptz_h.descnameTxt: When satisfied with the camera view, enter a descriptive name for the position in the Current position field.
ptz_h.helphomebxTxt: If required, check the box for Use current position as Home, see below.
ptz_h.helpsaveTxt: Click Add. This camera position is then saved as a preset position in the camera. The position can be assumed at any time, by selecting it from the drop-down list of available positions. Presets can be selected in Live View, from events, and from the Guard Tour
ptz_h.help3Txt: From the Available positions drop-down list, select the preset name to be deleted. Click Remove.
ptz_h.help4Txt: Checking this box for the current position will save this preset as the Home position, which is then readily accessible by clicking on the Home button in both the Preset Position Setup window and the Live View window. The position's name will also have (H) added to the end of it.
ptz_h.help5Txt: This setting is used to return the camera to the home position after a set time of viewing a preset position or a position set manually by the user. The interval is configurable from 0 seconds (i.e. disabled) to 300 seconds.
ptz_h.help6Txt: This setting is used to return the camera to the home position after a set time of viewing a preset position or a position set manually by the user. The interval is configurable from 0 seconds (i.e. disabled) to 300 seconds.
ptz_h.help7Txt: This setting is used to return the camera to the overview image after a set time of viewing a preset position or a position set manually by the user. The interval is configurable from 0 seconds (i.e. disabled) to 300 seconds.
ptz_h.help8Txt: This feature is useful for events that trigger on motion detection and which move the camera view from overview mode to a preset position. As motion detection is disabled for as long as the camera is not in overview mode, setting an automatic return to overview mode ensures that motion detection is re-enabled.
ptz_h.return_homeTxt: Enter how many seconds the camera can be inactive before automatically returning to the Home position. Disable this function by setting the time to '0'. Note that a Home position must be configured in order to access the Return to home when inactive feature.
ptz_h.setPan0_Txt: Click Set new Pan 0° to reset the pan coordinate system to zero in the current direction. The camera can be mounted in three different directions. Resetting pan may be useful if the camera is mounted so that it is pointing in an undesirable direction at Pan 0°. Note that, resetting Pan 0° will affect all previously defined presets, guard tours etc.

handle_button_h.introTxt1: To add a shortcut command button, follow these steps:
handle_button_h.introTxt3: Provide a label - this will be used as the button text.
handle_button_h.introTxt4: Optionally enter text in the Information field. This is used as the tooltip text that is displayed when the cursor is held over the button.
handle_button_h.introTxt5: URL - this is the path to an auxiliary command provided by the PTZ driver, or to some other command accessed via the HTTP API.
handle_button_h.introTxt7: If supported by the PTZ driver, it may be possible to enter the URL in the format: auxiliary:< command name >
handle_button_h.introTxt8: An HTTP API command should be entered in the format: < http-api-request >
handle_button_h.introTxt9: To open the URL in a new window, use link:< url >

panel_view_h.introTxt: This page provides the tools for managing the different controls provided for <abbr title='Pan, Tilt and Zoom'>PTZ</abbr>.
panel_view_h.listTxt1: Here are the controls for creating and saving Panel Shortcut Command Buttons. These buttons provide direct access to various built-in auxiliary commands provided by the PTZ driver. The buttons are displayed in the PTZ Panel, which is available on the Live View page by clicking the Ctrl panel button.
panel_view_h.listTxt2: The <abbr title='Pan, Tilt and Zoom'>PTZ</abbr> panel also provides various buttons as standard, depending on the <abbr title='Pan, Tilt and Zoom'>PTZ</abbr> driver being used. Examples of these are Autoiris, Autofocus, etc. The list of shortcut command buttons displays the available information for each configured command button.
panel_view_h.listTxt3: The Label is the text on the button itself
panel_view_h.listTxt4: Information is the text displayed for the button when the cursor is held over the button
panel_view_h.listTxt5: URL shows the path to the command
panel_view_h.listTxt6: Enable shows whether the selected command is enabled or not. This is controlled by the Enable/Disable button below the list.
panel_view_h.listTxt7: To work with shortcut command buttons, click Add to create a new button, or select an existing button from the list and click Modify or Remove.
panel_view_h.help7Txt: By checking/unchecking these boxes, the administrator can enable or disable the different controls for <abbr title='Pan, Tilt and Zoom'>PTZ</abbr>. These settings are used on every page where <abbr title='Pan, Tilt and Zoom'>PTZ</abbr> controls are usually found.

ptzQueue_h.intro_Txt1: The PTZ Control Queue is a system for placing PTZ control requests in a queue. The control queue fields on the Live View page show the user's current status and position in the queue and the amount of time remaining until PTZ control is given, or if the user already has control - the amount of control time remaining.
ptzQueue_h.intro_Txt2: This page provides the tools for setting up the PTZ Control Queue.
ptzQueue_h.enable_single_Txt: Enable PTZ Control Queue - This enables the queuing function and displays the user's status and position in the queue on the Live View page.
ptzQueue_h.enable_multi_Txt: Enable PTZ Control Queue for - Check the relevant box to enable the queuing function for the required video source. The user's status and position in the queue is displayed on the Live View page.
ptzQueue_h.limit_Txt: Limit number of users in queue to - This can be specified up to 100. The default value is 20.
ptzQueue_h.poll_Txt1: Control queue poll time - To keep the control queue more or less up-to-date, the waiting clients must regularly poll the Axis product to keep their place in the queue. If the client does not send a new poll query within the time set here (in seconds), the client will be dropped from the queue.
ptzQueue_h.poll_Txt2: Setting a higher value can lead to greater numbers of 'dead' requests in the queue, i.e. when clients leave the queue, but before this is detected. Setting too low a value, so that clients are required to send frequent poll queries, may result in the product becoming overloaded.
ptzQueue_h.save_Txt: Click Save to save the settings or click Reset to return to the previously saved values.

ptz_settings_h.ptz_settings_helpEnablePTZTxt: Enable digital PTZ - Check this box and click Save to enable digital pan/tilt/zoom and PTZ controls in Live View.
ptz_settings_h.ptz_settings_helpMaxZoomTxt: Max zoom - Set the maximum possible zoom rate in Live View. Note that by increasing the maximum zoom rate you will be decreasing the maximum possible resolution in the Live View Image. See Video & Audio > Video Stream Settings > Image.
ptz_settings_h.ptz_settings_helpLockTxt: Lock to current position - This option disables PTZ in the Live view. Click in the image or use the Pan/Tilt/Zoom controls to navigate the view to the desired area. Check lock to current position.

main_h.static_drivers:
Important!

Axis will under no circumstances guarantee the compatibility of any driver, conforming or otherwise, to a specific manufacturer's protocol.
main_h.no_static_drivers_1:
Important!

Although many PTZ drivers have been tested and found to work satisfactorily with the
main_h.no_static_drivers_2: , Axis will under no circumstances guarantee the compatibility of any driver, conforming or otherwise, to a specific manufacturer's protocol.
main_h.unknown_driver_1: For detailed information on the PTZ driver for a specific port, please go to the web page for that port, and from there use the direct link
